abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Poverty Alleviation
            Microfinance Project (Microfinance II) to Bangladesh aims to
            continue the International Development Association's
            (IDA's) support for poverty alleviation through
            microcredit. The Project has five main components. 1) The
            mainstream microfinance - rural microcredit component will
            continue to support horizontal and vertical expansion of
            rural microcredit, to respond to the unmet demand and the
            need for larger loans per borrower, respectively. 2) The
            urban microcredit component will support scaling-up of urban
            microcredit activities and will cover up to 270,000 urban
            borrowers. 3) The hard-core poor component will target
            program expansion, change the current microcredit delivery
            system, and diversify financial services. 4) The
            microenterprise lending component will help progressive or
            graduate microcredit borrowers or microentrepreneurs who
            have entrepreneurial talents to scale-up their activities.
            5) The institutional development component will strengthen
            Palli Karma-Sahayak Foundation's (PKSF) and small and
            medium-size partner organizations' (POs) capacity to
            increase outreach, broaden the range of financial services
            benefiting the poor and hard-core poor, and improve
            POs' creditworthiness and sustainability.
